Kung Fury.Title: Kung Fury (2015)
Kung Fury.Plot: Kung Fury is an over-the-top 80â€™s action comedy that was crowd funded through Kickstarter. It features Kung Fury, a Kung Fu renegade cop who travels back in time to kill his Nemesis, Hitler. The film features nazis, dinosaurs, vikings and cheesy one-liners.

Casino Jack and the United States of Mon.Title: Casino Jack and the United States of Money (2010)
Casino Jack and the United States of Mon.Plot: A probing investigation into the lies, greed and corruption surrounding D.C. super-lobbyist Jack Abramoff and his cronies.

Dark City.Title: Dark City (1950)
Dark City.Plot: When a crooked card game turns deadly, the remaining gamblers are the subject of a plot for vengeance.

Free To Play.Title: Free To Play (2014)
Free To Play.Plot: Follow three professional video game players as they overcome personal adversity, family pressures, and the realities of life to compete in a $1,000,000 tournament that could change their lives forever.

Who Needs Sleep.Title: Who Needs Sleep? (2004)
Who Needs Sleep.Plot: Unsettled by the preventable death of a coworker, filmmaker Haskell Wexler learns that sleep deprivation and long work hours are a deadly combination. Interweaving medical findings with personal accounts, his camera reveals how a 24/7 work culture affects all Americans.

Inside LSD.Title: Inside LSD (2009)
Inside LSD.Plot: Could LSD be the next drug in your doctor's arsenal? New experiments have a few researchers believing that this 'trippy' drug could become a pharmaceutical of the future, thinking it may enhance brain power, expand creativity, and cure disease.

The Making of Star Wars.Title: The Making of Star Wars (1977)
The Making of Star Wars.Plot: The story behind the making of 'Star Wars: A New Hope', the 1977 epic film which launched one of the most successful sagas of all time. This TV special, the first ever Star Wars documentary, was hosted by C-3PO and R2-D2 and narrated by William Conrad, with appearances by George Lucas, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher and Harrison Ford.

The Weight of a Nation.Title: The Weight of the Nation (2012)
The Weight of a Nation.Plot: The Weight of the Nation examines the long-term health consequences of obesity in America. It pays special attention to childhood weight problems and heart disease, the negative impact of high weight on heart and liver function, the link between weight gain and diabetes, and the social costs of the obesity epidemic.

CIA Secret Experiments.Title: CIA Secret Experiments (2008)
CIA Secret Experiments.Plot: It's the height of the Cold War and the United States government is desperate to combat the spread of Communism. The CIA launches a highly classified, top secret research program into the covert use of biological and chemical agents.

Inside North Korea.Title: Inside North Korea (2006)
Inside North Korea.Plot: Posing as a medical coordinator, Lisa Ling gains access to North Korea offering viewers a chance to see inside the 'Hermit Kingdom'.

The Fabric of the Cosmos: Quantum Leap.Title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: Quantum Leap (2011)
The Fabric of the Cosmos: Quantum Leap.Plot: This program explains some of the weirdest aspects of quantum mechanics: uncertainty and entanglement. Despite the absurdity of these behaviors they have been confirmed time and again and have never been refuted. Lastly the theory that suggests the possibility that teleportation and quantum computers may be possible are examined.

DEFCON.Title: DEFCON: The Documentary (2013)
DEFCON.Plot: DEFCON is the world's largest hacking conference, held in Las Vegas, Nevada. In 2012 it was held for the 20th time. The conference has strict no-filming policies, but for DEFCON 20, a documentary crew was allowed full access to the event. The film follows the four days of the conference, the events and people (attendees and staff), and covers history and philosophy behind DEFCON's success and unique experience.

China Rises - Getting Rich.Title: China Rises - Getting Rich (2006)
China Rises - Getting Rich.Plot: In 25 Years, China has achieved the most rapid economic advance in such a short time of any nation in history. How? By scrapping its devotion to collectivism and embracing private enterprise with the zeal of 19th-century robber barons. But is China's success riding on the backs of the poor?

Sita Sings the Blues.Title: Sita Sings the Blues (2008)
Sita Sings the Blues.Plot: 'Sita Sings the Blues' is based on the Hindu epic 'The Ramayana'. Sita is a goddess separated from her beloved Lord and husband Rama. Nina Paley is an animator whose husband moves to India, then dumps her by email. Three hilarious shadow puppets narrate both ancient tragedy and modern comedy in this beautifully animated interpretation of the Ramayana. Set to the 1920's jazz vocals of torch singer Annette Hanshaw, Sita Sings the Blues earns its tagline as 'the Greatest Break-Up Story Ever Told.' It is written, directed, produced and animated by American artist Nina Paley.
